bug.author: ebetica
bug.summary: Compressed replays sometimes cannot be read correctly
bug.description:
This doesn't happen very often, but sometimes I cannot read a compressed replay when I can read the uncompressed version. An example can be downloaded here: ï»¿<denchmark-link:https://www.dropbox.com/s/1bkntbkpm1zolnf/bwrep_7p5q6.rep?dl=0>https://www.dropbox.com/s/1bkntbkpm1zolnf/bwrep_7p5q6.rep?dl=0</denchmark-link>
Simply compress it with zstd zstd -e5 bwrep_7p5q6.rep -o bwrep_7p5q6.tcr In Python, I can do: <denchmark-code>from torchcraft import replayer rep = replayer.load("bwrep_7p5q6.rep") bad = replayer.load("bwrep_7p5q6.tcr") </denchmark-code>
Same thing happens in lua. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jgehring>@jgehring</denchmark-link> if you have any idea why this happens let me know.
